title: Executive Order 9201-Exemption of Morris B. Hostetter From Compulsory Retirement for Age
content: Whereas, in my judgment, the public interest requires that Morris B. Hostetter, Chief of Section, Accounting Department, The Panama Canal, who, during the current month, will reach the retirement age prescribed for automatic separation from the service, applicable to him, be exempted from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year:

Now, Therefore, by virtue of and pursuant to the authority rested in me by section 204 of the act of June 30, 1932, 47 Stat. 382, 404 (U.S.C., title 5, sec. 715a), I hereby exempt the said Morris B. Hostetter from compulsory retirement for age for a period of one year ending July 31, 1943.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 9201-Exemption of Morris B. Hostetter From Compulsory Retirement for Age Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/210854
